comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In March 1914, Wellesley was in the news because of a fire. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F01E3DC163AE633A... "FIRE DRILL SAVES 350 AT WELLESLEY; Girl Students in Night Attire March Calmly from Burning Dormitory. WELLESLEY, Mass., March 17. -- Perfect discipline, coolness, and bravery on the part of the students and Faculty members prevented any loss, of life or injury when College Hall, the oldest of the Wellesley College buildings, was burned to-day. Two hundred and fifty young woman students, fifty instructors, and fifty maids were in their beds when the fire was discovered. "
